thread.title: Muschamp updates Auburn's defensive injuries for Kentucky game
thread.title_full: Muschamp updates Auburn's defensive injuries for Kentucky game | AL.com

author: Wesley Sinor | wsinor@al.com
title: Muschamp updates Auburn's defensive injuries for Kentucky game
text:
Two of Auburn's injured defensive players will be healthy enough to play against Kentucky, according to defensive coordinator Will Muschamp.
Sophomore linebacker Tre' Williams (knee) and defensive back Tim Irvin (foot) were both held out of the the 35-21 win over San Jose State Oct. 4, but are expected back Thursday.
"Yes, Tre', he's fine," Muschamp said. "He's ready to go. And Tim Irvin as well."
Williams has recorded 19 tackles this season (five solo) and had a career-high 10 takedowns against LSU. Irvin has 12 tackles (four solo) with two pass deflections.
Meanwhile, cornerback T.J. Davis' status is less clear. The junior tore his ACL this spring and underwent surgery in March. He dressed for the San Jose State and participated in pregame warm-ups, but did not play against the Spartans.
"He's got to get to that confidence standpoint of going out there and cutting it loose in live contact and we're not totally there yet," Muschamp said. "He's moving around well, been very pleased with obviously where he is. It's been a very quick recovery and we just got to work through the confidence levels, making sure he feels comfortable going out and cutting on it."
Muschamp had no update when asked about injured defensive end/Buck Carl Lawson, who went down in the first half against Louisville.
Auburn is a slight favorite over Kentucky for Thursday's game at 6:30 p.m.
Auburn defensive coordinator Will Muschamp: Oct. 11, 2015 Auburn defensive coordinator Will Muschamp talks with the media after practice Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015, in Auburn, Ala. (Julie Bennett/jbennett@al.com)
